Reviews.Title: “Really good value, spotless, but not near centre”
Reviews.Author: Mike A
Reviews.Content: March 28 2012 We had a three night holiday. Quiet safe area Good parking. Excellent room and en suite. Good breakfast, No pool, public rooms ex unused bar. 10 min bus ride to cafes etc. No food at other times Big disadvantage it's not near the centre and getting there takes an age. To get there from the Fiumico airport... If under 65, buy your Roma Pass at the airport Tourist office, otherwise buy metro/bus tickets at the tobacconist opposite the office- We bought a three day and a one day pass there. a) get a taxi to the hotel, good value if there's 4 of you. or b) get the bus shuttle for 4 to Termini or c ) get the non stop train to Termini, pricey, then metro see below or c) get the slow train to Ostiense station, 8 Euro, walk to Pyramids metro (not far) metro( Line B) to Termini At Termini switch to line A, towards Anagnina, get off at Subaugusta Outside the station , get the 558 bus just past the corner restaurant towards Torre Maura, 10 minute ride. Get off at Romanista Giaquinto ( 2 stops past a petrol station on the right, before a petrol station on the left, 100 metres further on, turn right, hotel 100 metres on the left. The corner restaurant by Subaugusta does a great happy hour (up to 2030), plie of food plus any drink, 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “When is a hotel in Rome not a hotel in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: SmiffyWorthing
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern, clean and comfortable, and the staff were helpful and spoke good English. That's where the good stuff ends. Supposedly 4 stars, the hotel is situated way out of the city centre in a residential suburb of Rome, and miles from the airport. Whilst our room was clean and comfortable, we were amazed to find no tea/coffee making facilities in the room (a must as far as I'm concerned and surely a standard feature these days?). There were just 4 coat hangers between two of us, no drawer space, no extractor fan in the internal bathroom, no shower gel and they were mean with the toilet rolls! The "fridg-o-box" drinks cabinet, which housed only soft drinks and water, was not chilled which we found rather pointless. There is no kitchen as such, so no facility for lunch or dinner, and being situated in a residential area there are very few restaurants nearby, although there is a supermarket right next door. Breakfast was just continental with the only hot food available being scrambled egg with pieces of bacon mixed in, or frankfurters which, as a vegetarian, I couldn't eat. After three days eating the same breakfast I never want to see a cheese roll again as long as I live! The "dining room" itself was large, cold, impersonal and utilitarian and felt more like a canteen than a restaurant. Being subterranean there was no natural light and it lacked warmth and atmosphere. We had no hot water for 2 of our 3 days and to top it all, when we checked out we were informed that we had to pay "city taxes" - 3 euros per person per night! A 4 star hotel? No way. I wouldn't stay there again and certainly would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvenient & soulless”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterMary01
Reviews.Content: Inconvenient location for a city break, the back of beyond. Stayed 3 nights, woken by comings and goings of travellers on 2 of them. No snack/food facilities apart from breakfast. Supermarket next door. One local eatery. Bar was closed 2 visits out of 3. Room clean but top bed cover stained. I think 3 star would be more appropriate. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Boom time build to bust...”
Reviews.Author: anthonyruk
Reviews.Content: Typical 00's design airport hotel on the cheap, located in the middle of a Rome suburb, but still close to Ciampino airport. Only staying here because of meeting located nearby, but otherwise would be suspicious of any operator claiming this to be a Rome hotel, if you're looking to access Rome as a city. Rooms are spotless, beds, thin mattress but comfortable, my bathroom looked like it had been built in one of those 60 minute make-over shows- fittings not secure, not aligned, but again spotlessly clean.. Check in staff were very friendly and courteous.. WIfi is 4 euro, a bargain! Seems to be mainly used as a close to Ciampino airport stop-over,fortunate to be built in the building boom with lots of borrowed cash..doubt it would find investment in todays tough environment.. Taxi waiting time is minimum 10 mins, and persuading a taxi driver at FCO to take us here was a task- 40km and on the other side of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Worldtoddler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there this summer for 4 nights with my mum. We loved the room. Stylish and cool. Breakfast is ok for Italy. A bit far from the center, but for the price paid in the middle of season - its cool. Nice staff and great design. Would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “UK Travellers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: g g
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October 2011, and despite being told by the travel agent that we would be fine on public transport (as the hotel is outside the centre), this was not the case. On arrival at Termini station, we found that people just did not know where the hotel was. We were told conflicting advice by two tourist information boards and bus drivers. As advised we took the number 5 tram, which we were told would take us 800 meters from the hotel. When we got off the tram we found we were hopelessly lost, nobody had heard off the hotel let alone the road. One kind Italian man walked around with us for over an hour asking people directions on our behalf. In the end a stall holder called a taxi for us. 4 exhausting hours later after landing we arrived at the hotel. The next day we took a taxi to the centre and found that we had the same problem returning back to the hotel in the afternoon. Many taxi drivers either didn’t know where the hotel was or didn’t want to travel the long distance to the hotel and it was like déjà vu. The hotel itself was okay, but because we booked through a tour operator paid more than the prices on the hotel website. Breakfast was okay if you like continental breakfasts, but the room was clean with daily housekeeping. Rooms are not sound proof. The reception staff were not very friendly and did not seem concerned with practicalities of having to travel on public transport. Evening meals are non-existent and there is no -where to have a proper meal. Hotel should be 3 stars not 4. Also when buying train tickets remember to validate any tickets you buy at the yellow machines prior to getting on train or you will be fined 25 euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, but far from the center”
Reviews.Author: broccoli_lover
Reviews.Content: I stay 3 nights at the Artis Hotel, in a Triple Room, it was a good size room, the breakfast was average, but the hotel do not have a restaurant. The hotel has a lounge/bar downstairs but only opens at night, as well as the other restaurants that are nearby. The bus stop is about 10 min walking from the hotel, and it will get you to Termini, the ride is like 40 min, and the bus is always full of people. You have to buy the ticket for the bus far from the bus stop at the tabbacchi. The location is not very good, is in a residencial area and far from the center

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a loooooonngg way out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: josieg1987
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very nice with lovely rooms and helpful multilingual staff. However, it is a VERY long way out of the centre of Rome and a bit of a nightmare to be honest. To go into the city in the morning we would walk 5mins to the bus stop, get the 558 bus from Rottastini (I think it was called) to the Sub Augusta Metro station, which took around 10minutes - so long as the bus arrived quickly - at times we waited 20mins in the heat for a bus to come. Then down to the metro and a case of waiting around 10-15 stops on metro which can take around 30-40minutes. In early september when we went it is very hot walking around and we wanted to freshen up for evening meal/opera etc. This meant we had to allow 2hours to get back to hotel. Then shower/change and allow 2hours to get back in to city for dinner (absolute nightmare and big time waste). this also caused problems for our evenings in rome because on friday night metro closes at 9pm and there are only night buses - we waited so long for bus that eventually we gave in and paid 30euros for taxi home. I would def recommend paying more for the hotel just for convenience as it was a real drag on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but a long way from the centre”
Reviews.Author: thetaxwoman
Reviews.Content: Driving to Rome, we found the hotel easily enough using sat nav. Plenty of parking, a pleasant room, with all the necessary facilities, and still new enough to be smart. Absolutely no complaints about the accommodation - it was good. Breakfast wasn't much to write home about, especially over the Easter weekend when there seemed to be no supply of fresh bread or fruit, but it was plentiful and provided enough to fuel us till lunchtime. Some members of staff were very helpful - the barman and Magdalena at reception in particular. Others appeared to speak little English, and a couple of others didn't seem to want to help. But on the whole, there were no problems, and no-one was rude or went out of their way to be unhelpful. The hotel doesn't serve anything except breakfast, and there are very few local eating places within walking distance. Those we found only accepted cash. The main issue we had was getting in and out of the city centre. The hotel doesn't provide any information in the room, and although there are public transport links, they aren't easy to find out about. Despite being assured by those in the know that it wasn't possible to miss the bus/tram stop, we, and many others, did. Getting back out of the city proved difficult, primarily because no-one had heard of the hotel and we weren't sure exactly where it was! Taxi drivers reverted to phoning the hotel reception for directions or denying that it existed; the tourist information office gave us wrong tram line numbers; even local bars didn't know about it! It all proved quite an adventure, and an expensive one at that. But those of our group who did work the public transport system out found it easy and cheap to use. So to summarise, it's a good place to base yourself if you just want a comfortable modern room and an acceptable breakfast at a reasonable price (€99 room and breakfast per night at Easter weekend 2011). But prepare yourself with plenty of information about where and how to get buses and trams, or if you're taking a taxi, make sure you have the hotel's address and phone number to show th driver!

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: FiddlegirlHull
Reviews.Content: Fine but far out. Only go here if you are confident with public transport. Not easy, especially if you want to stay in town after 9 pm and you have to use the night bus because the metro has closed! Breakfast was ok. Lovely capuccinos served every morning from the bar (the machine coffee was horrible). Room was ok - high heels in the room above caused disturbance clicking around.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: yael_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for rour nights, after we read its a 4 star hotel. In reality its less then a 3 star hotel . First it is far from the center (you have to take a bus that rides for 15 minutes and then 18 stops in the metro!!!) then there is the breakfast which is far from being good they give the minimal possible.. There are no cables to conect the computer so if you would like to use the internet, you have to sit in the lobby (but there are not even tables to sit next to). Some of the stuff members are unfriendly (she smiles but she is not very halpful). The good thing about the hotel that it is clean and the rooms are big but that'sall there is to it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on the outskirts of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Soph1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12th March - 15th March. Rooms were fantastic, cleaned daily with fresh towels and bedding. Breakfast was a little disappointing but for the price of the stay, it was OK - pastries, bread, ham, cheese and cereals. The locatio fo the hotel was good. It was in the middle of everything and was a small bus ride away from the metro. Do not follow the directions on the hotel website though because you will never find it. take Metro line A to Cinécitta and catch 558 bus. Ask someone to let you know when to get off. The hotel is next door to a supermarket - with a good bottle of rosé for €1! Reception staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “brain new hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterfxn22
Reviews.Content: a beautiful hotel, new, renovated, on the outskirts of Rome, breakfast is not much of a girlfriend and is not near the metro station (they say it will open in 2012) but the price and service well worth the stay. Senior goalkeeper in the afternoon it seemed a bit 'pushy but otherwise ok.................................................................................................................................................................

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Artis
HotelInfo.Address: Via Roberto Fancelli 3, 00169 Rome, Italy
